answers.answer: Hi, is it bowel movements? If it is not accompanied by bowel symptoms, your symptoms could be due to neuropathy. It is a disorder of the nerves which causes numbness, tingling, unusual sensations and sometimes pain. Diabetes Mellitus can cause neuropathy. Other causes like vitamin deficiencies, alcohol consumption and certain medications can cause neuropathy. Please discuss this with your doctor am sure he will provide further assistance. Regards.

question: For over thirty years now, I have had a crawling feeling in my stomach nearly every night. I have to put pillows under my stomach just to be able to lay still long enough to be able to go to sleep. i ask my doctor and he has no idea at all what may be causing it.It mostly happens at night, be sometimes during the day as well. If I am sitting watching tv or eating I will have to get up and walk aroundDoes anyone have any idea what could be causing this and a way to stop it?
title: Crawling feelng in stomach
